@tomfgoodwin @PaulRogers73 As do I. But you donâ€™t think the cacaphony of voices demanding action, even if â€œvague,â€ wonâ€™t inspire action? Weâ€™re dealing with deeply systemic issues â€” if protesting inspires one â€œadultâ€ to reconsider their stance or introduce new policy, thatâ€™s a win. Again, one of many steps.

@tomfgoodwin An action of this scale forces a conversation being avoided by our country. Even if it causes people to ask, â€œWhatâ€˜s the point of marching,â€ across the dinner table (or on Twitter), itâ€™s shining a light on an issue and itâ€™s all incremental progress.

@tomfgoodwin I agree itâ€™s easier to rally people FOR something than against something. Why Iâ€™ve eliminated the word â€œresistâ€ from my vocab â€” itâ€™s reactive, defensive, divisive. However, I disagree on a need for specificity at this moment. This is a first step of many.
https://t.co/n8MmFJnD16
@tomfgoodwin Huh? Itâ€™s literally people who otherwise may not have done anything, now doing something that could directly impact policy change. https://t.co/szhb67kGXx

@tomfgoodwin @womensmarch Ask @spanberger @LUnderwood630 @ErinForYall @DocTran2018 if the @womensmarch accomplished anything.
â€œRoughly 900 women contacted @emilyslist... about running for office from 2015 to 2016; since President Trumpâ€™s election, 26k+ women have reached out about launching a campaign. https://t.co/a9OBdkRLOA

If this isnâ€™t action, I donâ€™t know what is.
â€œThere is an unprecedented surge of first-time female candidates, overwhelmingly Democratic, running for offices big and small, from the U.S. Senate and state legislatures to local school boards.â€ https://t.co/CfAo20G97H

Protest and civil disobedience raise mass awarenes, give people a sense of voice, and inspire action. Sure, 90% of people at the @womensmarch patted themselves on the back, went home, and got back on Facebook, but it was a seminal moment that galvanized the other 10% into action.

Youâ€™re missing the point. Easy to dismiss some people on TV in Florida. Harder to dismiss droves of people in your backyard. Your assertion assumes that protest is the only element of activism â€” itâ€™s one of many tools, just like TV ads arenâ€™t the only tactic in marketing. https://t.co/UB36Mud8Xo
